p: Medicinal plants are referred to as major source of nourishments and natural metabolites for maintaining sound health [ 53]. They are also referred to as indispensable natural compounds with vast number of pharmacological activities [ 54, 55, 56]. Since inception, medicinal plants and herbal drugs are used in treatment of various kinds of acute and chronic diseases [ 2, 56, 57]. The therapeutic or curative significance of S. media in has gained global recognition mostly because of its relevance in traditional medicine. These curative applications could be due to bioactive metabolites such as minerals, vitamins, and other essential nutrients appraised [ 34]. Phytochemical assessment and dietary appraisals of different parts of S. media revealed presence of essential antioxidant vitamins, phenolic compounds and glycosides [ 12, 13, 23, 34, 41].
